alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 04 at 1:45PM MDT until May 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM THIS EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN, CENTRAL AND EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM FRIDAY FOR MOST OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT SATURDAY FOR MOST OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Increasing southwest flow aloft will spread very dry air over the region through Saturday. Strong southwest winds, very low humidity, seasonably warm temperatures, and an unstable airmass will lead to several hours of critical fire weather conditions across parts of the region in receptive fuels and below snowpack. In addition, lightning strikes from earlier this week may lead to new ignitions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), East Central Plains (Zone 126), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123), and Northeast Plains (104) until 8 pm MDT this evening then again Friday and Saturday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph this afternoon and evening, Friday, and Saturday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...9 to 15 percent this afternoon and 6 to 12 percent on Friday and Saturday. About 8 to 12 consecutive hours of single digit humidity are possible for much of the area Friday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Mountains
